parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle - 1st Person Plural
str2: To begin. Middle voice of archo; to commence.
To place together, commend, prove, exhibit; instrans: I stand with; To be composed of, cohere.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural

str2: Probably from the same as pale; anew, i.e. back, once more, or furthermore or on the other hand.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To need, have need of, want, desire. From chreia; to make necessity, i.e. Be in want of.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
A letter, dispatch, epistle, message. From epistello; a written message.
Commendatory, introductory. From a derivative of sunistao; introductory, i.e. Recommendatory.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
